p.s: The importance of student exchanges has been discussed a lot in the past.
In the following I will summarise the experiences of my friend Bianca, who did an exchange in India.
Bianca is an 18-year-old German volunteer who worked in an Education Center for childrinchildren, located in a slum of Delhi.
During her time in Delhi, she usually stood up early at 8:30 amante meridiem.
She mentions, the best thing of the exchange were the children who were full of acceptance and full of love.
This was especially astonishing, as children in Germany never acted like this.
Furthermore the children in the slums didn't live under good conditions.
At the end of the day, it was an experience with love, hope, confidence, patience and a lot of gratitude.
She owes all of this to the children.
